references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This paper introduced the influential ResNet architecture, which is a key component of the proposed method's architecture and is foundational to many modern computer vision models.
This paper introduced the Transformer architecture, which forms the backbone of the proposed Dual-Stream Interactive Transformer model and has revolutionized many areas of deep learning.

references.paper_title: An image is worth 16x16 words: Transformers for image recognition at scale
references.reason: This work successfully applied the Transformer architecture to image processing, paving the way for using Transformers in the low-level vision tasks addressed in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Trash or treasure? an interactive dual-stream strategy for single image reflection separation
references.reason: This is a previous work by two of the current paper's authors that directly addresses the single image reflection separation problem, establishing a baseline approach and providing conceptual groundwork for this research.

references.paper_title: Single image reflection separation via component synergy
references.reason: This is another previous work by two of the current paper's authors that builds upon their earlier work, further developing the dual-stream approach and providing more advanced techniques for reflection separation.
